Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can accurately draw and label different plants and animals, including humans.
The student can draw and label the places where different plants and animals live, such as forests, lakes, fields, etc.
The student can show what plants and animals need to survive in their drawings, including water, air, and land resources like soil and rocks.
The student can illustrate how animals rely on their environments to meet their needs (e.g., fish need water to swim, deer need leaves to eat).
The student can demonstrate how plants get what they need from their environments, like sunlight and water.
The student can clearly show the relationships between where different plants and animals live, and the resources these places provide.
The student can depict how all elements, including plants, animals, and environments, work together as a system to meet the needs of living things.
